Articles.Content: I've been playing Kerbal Space Program since 2011, I never bothered to join the forums because universally, I hate forum boards. But now I think I'll give them a shot. My favourite KSP Version was 0.17.4, you know, the one before they overhauled the Graphics and made Moho no longer a real challenge... I lost interest in the game back in .21, and I've tried to get back into the game, but I don't know how to find it interesting anymore, and I'd like some help with regaining interest really, so I decided to come over to the Forums and see what happens here.

> 
> I've been playing Kerbal Space Program since 2011, I never bothered to join the forums because universally, I hate forum boards. But now I think I'll give them a shot. My favourite KSP Version was 0.17.4, you know, the one before they overhauled the Graphics and made Moho no longer a real challenge... I lost interest in the game back in .21, and I've tried to get back into the game, but I don't know how to find it interesting anymore, and I'd like some help with regaining interest really, so I decided to come over to the Forums and see what happens here.

Welcome, hope you re-enjoy the game ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)
Welcome to the Forums! You might want to join a company in the [RB section](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/forums/52-Rocket-Builders), they always need people to build craft for them.
Welcome aboard, old timer! As always, the [Challenges](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/forums/26-Challenges) section is a good section for you to try if you need a... Well, a challenge.
This community is one of the best you can ever find, so you won't be disappointed!

Welcome back in space time, your interests limits are only your owns, simple ; fix some new ones.

KSP ,by essence is an endless source of enternaiment and things to try around ; ). 

Tommorow is sometime yesterday but not always.

I have suggestion. Do a Grand Tour, it's fun and although time-consuming will definetly keep you busy.

Welcome aboard!

What part of the game did you enjoy most last time? Rockets, spaceplanes, building contraptions or actually going to and landing on other planets/moons? if you're burnt out on one aspect give another a go. I love building stuff that never gets used. Others love using craft that others have built to fulfil their solar system conquering dreams because they hate the building phase. There's plenty to do and if in doubt build a sea faring ship....takes AGES (for me at least) and will log another 10-20 hours ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Tweety

Sorry I didn't reply to any messages, a few days ago I had a Cardiac Arrest, and I've been out cold for a few days. Does anyone know if there are Docking Autopilots still around? Is that Deep Space Mission Pack inspired by 2001 Space Odyssey still here? Does Bobcat still make those amazing rovers? As for what most of the replies have been, I can't find *anything* in the game interesting anymore, seriously, I've done it all before and it just isn't as interesting as it was. Though I keep having these "Interstellar Quest" videos in my Subbox on YT from Scott Manley, what's that all about?
